com.itko.util

Class Parameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.util.Parameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CloneImplemented, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Parameter
extends java.lang.Object
implements CloneImplemented, java.io.Serializable
    The Parameter class maintains a name-value pair or a singleton value. It is best used with the ParameterList class that will create and collect these items for you.
    Version:
    1
    See Also:
    ParameterList, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parameter

        public Parameter(java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.String key,
         java.lang.String value,
         java.lang.Object type)
        Constructs a parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - - a human-readable label for the parameter. Used at times when you need to build dynamic user interfaces from a ParameterList
        key - - the key to store and recall this parameter with
        value - - the value for this parameter
        type - - the Parameter's type, see the class description for more

      • Parameter

        Constructs a parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - - a human-readable label for the parameter. Used at times when you need to build dynamic user interfaces from a ParameterList
        key - - the key to store and recall this parameter with
        value - - the value for this parameter
        type - - the Parameter's type, see the class description for more
        enableValidation - - Enable Validation in Custom Editor

      • Parameter

        public Parameter(java.lang.String singleToken)
        Constructs a parameter that is a single-value type parameter. IE, it doesn't have a key and value, and shouldn't render that way. If that doesn't make sense, see the methods on the ParameterList class that render Parameters into Strings
        Parameters:
        singleToken - - the value to store as a parameter
        See Also:
        ParameterList

      • Parameter

        public Parameter(org.w3c.dom.Element paramEl)

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Allows us to set a label or name for the Parameter. Differs from the key in that it can be useful for labeling a field on a form, for example.
        Parameters:
        name - the label for the parameter

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the label for this parameter. If not provided, will give you the key.
        Returns:
        the label/name for this parameter

      • getType

        public java.lang.Object getType()
        Returns the Parameter's declared type. It's a very fuzzy thing, but there's a more complete discussion at the top of this class
        Returns:
        the Paramter's type or a null if one is not set (Assume a String)
